title: Seared cod loin with pepper and caper sauce and potatoes
directions: 1 Preheat the oven to 220°C, fan 200°C, gas 7.
2 Tip the potatoes on to a baking tray and gently crush. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon oil, half a teaspoon of caster sugar and a small pinch of salt. Roast for 30 minutes.

3 Meanwhile, fry the onion in 1 tablespoon of olive oil with the mixed herbs and garlic, until softened. Add the wine and cook until most of it has been absorbed. Add the tomatoes and simmer for 5 minutes. Tip into a food processor, add the roasted peppers and blitz until smooth. Return to the pan and add the lemon juice, remaining sugar and capers. Warm through.
4 Season the cod and fry in 1 tablespoon of oil for 4 minutes on each side until cooked through. Serve with the crushed potatoes and sauce, garnished with the basil.
ingredients:
600 g
Charlotte potatoes by Sainsbury's, scrubbed and boiled until tender

3 cloves
garlic, peeled and finely chopped

400 g
tin Taste the Difference Pomodorini cherry tomatoes in rich tomato sauce
2 roasted red peppers, deseeded from a jar

600 g
skinless & boneless cod fillets by Sainsbury's
fresh basil leaf, washed, to garnish
